info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 11:42AM CDT until June 29 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS St Louis MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Missouri, including the following county, southern Crawford.
* WHEN...Until 215 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1142 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Steelville, Cherryville, Cook Station, Davisville and Dillard.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
